title: In-situ 4D-STEM Study of Chemo-Mechanical Interactions during Metal Oxidation
content: Zirconium- (Zr-) based alloys, utilized as cladding material for nuclear reactor fuel, are susceptible to oxidation under harsh reactor operation conditions. Zr oxidation can compromise the integrity of cladding by diminishing mechanical strength and ductility, thereby increasing the likelihood of failure and constraining operational lifespan. Oxidation induces stress redistribution and strain anisotropy in the metal substrate. Effective strain mapping techniques for oxidation reactions could benefit strain distribution/localization observation and further propel the elucidation of zirconium oxidation mechanisms, which currently lack consensus in the scientific community.
